turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: See this is why we're not watching those news reports. People get obsessed.  I'm letting go now.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: You don't even know what that word means.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: It's not contaminated. It's just tap water. Pour it in his bowl.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: He licks his butt everyday. He's not going to mind.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Not English though. You heard the voices right Uncle Merrill?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Listen Bo. This is very important. Everything people have written about in science books is going to change. The history of the world's future is on the TV right now. We need to record this so you can show your children this tape and say you were there...  For your children Bo.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: I don't want you to die.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Who said I was going to die?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I was just taking a walk before dinner.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: ...Tell Morgan to play games -- it's okay to be silly.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: ...Tell Bo to listen to her brother. He'll always take care of her.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Tell him... See. Tell him to see.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: And tell Merrill to swing away.

turns.speaker: CREWCUT GUY
turns.text: I've had two separate folks tell me they think there are strangers around these parts the last couple of nights. Can't tell what they look like, cause they're staying in the shadows -- covert like. No one's got hurt mind you... And that's the give away.

turns.speaker: CREWCUT GUY
turns.text: It's called probing. It's a military procedure. You send a reconnaissance group, very small, to check out things. Not to engage, but to evaluate the situation. Evaluate the level of danger. Make sure things are all clear...

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: I got the bat at home... On the wall.

turns.speaker: CREWCUT GUY
turns.text: You got two minor league home run records don't you?

turns.speaker: CREWCUT GUY
turns.text: Boy, why aren't you in the pros making stacks of cash and getting handfuls of T and A?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Okay, this guy is trying to scare us. He's messed with our property, he's coming around the house. It's time for an ass whoopin'!

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: This is not an intelligent way to approach this.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: You don't mean it. It's just for show.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It doesn't sound natural when I curse.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Are you going to do this or what?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: You want him coming in the house next time?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: This guy got on the roof in like a second.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Bo, can you turn down the volume until Officer Paski leaves?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: That roof is over ten feet high.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He's telling you the truth, Edgar. Whoever it was, is very strong and can jump pretty high.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I don't want any one of you spending time with Tracey Abernathy alone. Is that understood?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's broken Morgan. It'll just keep doing this.  Let's get out of the car okay?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's probably picking up another baby monitor.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Do you think it's a possibility?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: That wasn't the answer you wanted?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Can you at least pretend to be like you used to be? Give me some comfort?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: For the kids protection. All they were doing was watching TV from five a.m. I felt like they were getting obsessed like you said. They should be playing furry, furry rabbit or tea party or something right?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: That's a game isn't it?  Anyway...  There's been some interesting developments.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: They caught it on tape and they've been playing it all morning. They found the bird. His head crushed in. When you see the footage it looks like the bird flew into a wall in the sky.  They think they have some invisible shield thing going, like an optical illusion.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: The bird could have had a heart attack and crushed his head when he fell.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Already thought of. Two other birds did the same thing an hour later. Not as dramatic. They lived. But you could see they hit something.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: I'm sorry, what book is this?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Did they say what our chances would be if they did invade?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Good choice... I'm going to have a cheeseburger with bacon.  Extra bacon.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Should we turn off the lights?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: While they were trying to fix her up, all she kept asking about was you.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: This is going to do nothing.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We have to go in the basement.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Did I ever tell you, I dislocated Uncle Merrill's arm?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Should we make a run for it out the back?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He was only a year and half old.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He was trying to eat a second chocolate bar. Your grandma said, "No." He tried to take a bite, so I grabbed it.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: We won't be able to get out of there.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: I'm sorry I hurt your arm.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: It came on about two hours ago. Woke me up.  We won Graham.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: They think over a hundred thousand. They're just estimates.  But we held strong.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: How do they know it's over?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: A mass evacuation by them started about eight o'clock this morning. It's eleven now.  They're leaving. Beat.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Listen, there's things I can take and a couple things I can't and one of them I can't take, is when my older brother --  -- who is everything I want to be, starts losing faith in things. I saw your eyes last night.  I don't want to ever see your eyes like that again, okay? I'm serious.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: He's been like that for awhile. We need to get him some medicine.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Have they said anything about our area?

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: Philadelphia and its outlying counties are cleared, but who knows for sure?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: He's not strong enough to fight off another attack.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: I know.  We need to be sure, before we open that door Graham.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Can I use Bo's old baby monitor as a walkie-talkie?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: These are D's; I need double A's.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: It's still making the noises. It's broken.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We can't just sit in the car in our own driveway like this.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: It gets clearer, the higher you hold it.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: So the aliens can't read our minds.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: They tell you everything in this book.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: It says they're probably very small -- like my height -- because, as their brains developed, there was no use for physical development. It says they're probably vegetarians, because they would have realized the benefits of such a diet.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Scientists who have been persecuted for their beliefs.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Dr. Bimboo, one of the authors of the book --

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Tell me something Morgan. In that book of your, did they happen to detail what would happen if they were hostile?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Yes. They would invade us using only ground tactics. Hand to hand combat. They wouldn't use their technology or fight an airborne battle, because they would know we would eventually use nuclear weapons and the planet would be useless to them.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: They said one of two things could happen. One, they fight and are defeated and leave to return again with full forces hundreds or even thousands of years later.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: What do you think about the idea that they don't like places near water, and we might be safe from them near a lake or something?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We'll have to board up the bedroom doors.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Where are we going to sleep?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: We'll keep her in the garage, after dinner.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Now we're talking.  How about you Merrill?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: I hope they're doing better than we are. We don't even have helmets.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Yeah baby. I think someone did.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Don't call me Father. It's just Graham now.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: You said something was strange. What's strange?

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: What kind of machine can bend a stalk of corn over without cracking it?

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: Second thing this week I can't explain.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: Some animals around the county exhibiting uncharacteristic behavior. Sometimes violent behavior. Theo Henry had two of his fingers bit off by his cow.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: No Father, they're edgy. On alert. Like they act when they smell a predator around... Peeing on themselves and everything.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: You can't describe him at all? Don't you think that's find of odd?

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It does seem kind of odd doesn't it?

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: I don't know whether to look for a midget or a --

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: Let me ask you two something. Don't be embarrassed by the answer. It is possible... Just possible now, you might have been chasing each other around? You said you went in opposite directions.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: Edgar, it sounds as strange to me saying it, as it is to you hearing it. But we couldn't see him. He stayed mostly in the shadows. All we could make out was movement.  But I'll tell you something with absolute certainty. There was someone watching our house last night. He was looking in my children's windows and I want you to find him Edgar.  I need you to take this seriously, just in case, it is something serious.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: Do you owe anybody money? You can tell me off the record if you need too.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: But I'll tell you something, what I said in their, still goes. You and your family have been through a lot in the last two days... Not to mention what happened to you all seven months ago.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: It's left its mark still. The last thing these children need to do, is worry about some crazy things happening in the world. Take them into town. Get their minds -- your mind, on everyday things. It's good medicine.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: It's good advice...  Say hi to Marcia for me.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: You take care of yourself...  Graham.

turns.speaker: GRAHAM
turns.text: There was an accident. Drunk driving. They weren't sure.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: He wasn't drinking. Ray fell asleep at the wheel.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: Yes... That's the first thing Colleen asked too.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: She's not in an ambulance Father.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: See Father, Ray's truck swerved off the road and ah... Hit Colleen and then a tree. She was pinned between the two.

turns.speaker: OFFICER PASKI
turns.text: The truck... the truck has severed most of her lower half.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: They think these look like stages immediately proceeding an attack maneuver.

turns.speaker: MERRILL
turns.text: It's like War of the Worlds.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: They think it might happen all at once.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Some guy had a sign that said it was the end of the world.  Nothing really bad is going to happen, is it Uncle Merrill?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: The book says they're probably very good problem solvers.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I wouldn't do that. You're going to need every gun when that posse gets here.

turns.speaker: DAWSON
turns.text: Posse? What the hell you talking about?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: My partner and me robbed the bank in Turley and headed out with a posse on our tails. My partner there caught one a ways back, and I think he kicked off while I was looking for this damn canyon. You're Dawson, ain't you? I'm Tex LaRue.  Used to ride with Ry Morris. You know him. Well, Andy Sims told me there was a hideout here, so I headed for it. Hope you don't mind.

turns.speaker: DAWSON
turns.text: You brought a posse to my best hideout and you want to know if I mind. Mister, I don't know any of those names and you're about to die.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Wait a minute! If you don't believe me, ask them...  ...they saw me and my pal in Turley before we did the job.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I'd get down if I were you. They may be up there now.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: The money's in my saddlebags over there, but I ain't stepping out to get it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: If we charge them, they won't have a chance. But we gotta get to the horses.

turns.speaker: DAWSON
turns.text: What do you mean, the horses?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Emmett! Am I glad to see you!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Howdy, Jake. What's going on here?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You got me. This is a crazy town, Emmett. I think we ought to get out of here.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: All I did was kiss a girl.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That's why they got you in jail?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, I kissed a girl and this guy didn't like it and we had some words, so I decided to get out of there.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: So I did, I got out of there, I don't want no trouble. You know me.  So I walked out on the street and the fella tried to shoot me in the back.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, no, no! I winged him, and he dropped his gun.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You're in here for winging a guy?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, no, not exactly. See then his friend opened up on me.
